result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven C. ECKELBERG

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

The State moves to dismiss and read in all counts.  The defendant plead to a charge of violate harassment restraining order in 16 CM 58.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 11-08-2016 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 3.
Plea date on November 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in custody.
The report of Dr. Chapin has been reviewed by all parties.
The parties agree that, based on the defendants treatment, he is now competent to proceed in these matters.
NOT GUILTY pleas to all counts. Jury calendar.
Status conference is set for 10-04-16 at 3:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Report of Lesley Chapin, Psy.D. (LOCATED IN 16 CM 58)
Cover sheet for Confidential Documents.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a Status Conference on 08-31-2016 at 11:30 a.m.
Copy filed.
Status conference on August 31, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on August 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Petition for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency.  Order Appointing Attorney Donald Chewning as counsel of record through Manitowoc County.
Report of Michael L. Hammer, Ph.D., Licensed Psychologist. (Found in 16 CM 58)
Letters from Steve Eckelberg to Judge Fox.
Letter from Monica Zauner to Judge Fox.
Order of Commitment for Treatment.

Defendant in custody.   
Court finds on the report of Dr. Pankiewicz that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Court will prepare an order to transport the defendant to Mendota.   Court further finds that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication.   
Minutes.
Review hearing on July 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Report of John Pankiewicz, M.D. Board Certified Psychiatrist.  (ORIGINAL FILED IN 16 CM 58)
Competency hearing on April 27, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven C. ECKELBERG
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 03-28-2016)
Prior: 953 N. 8th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Defendant in custody.   
Attorney Larson raises the issue of competency.  Court orders an examination of the defendant.   Bail is set at $350.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Violate harassment injunction, on 02-23-16.
Initial appearance is set for 03-28-16 at 1:30 p.m.
